content:
• Tuesday, May 15, 2018
  • CYAD

    Celyad -3.3% after announcing 1.8M-unit offering

    • Clinical-stage biopharmaceutical firm Celyad (NASDAQ:CYAD) is off 3.3% in U.S. trading after announcing a plan to sell 1.8M units in a global offering.
    • The Belgium-based company's offering will be American Depositary Shares in the U.S., Canada and certain other non-European countries, and ordinary shares in Europe and certain other non-North American countries.
    • Each ADS represents the right to one ordinary share.
    • Underwriters will have a 30-day option to buy up to 15% more of the total number of units under the same terms.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:33 PM
  • BRK.A

    Berkshire doubles stake in Teva; adds to Apple, Monsanto in Q1

    • Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway (BRK.A, BRK.B) discloses sharply increased positions in Teva Pharmaceuticals (NYSE:TEVA), Monsanto (NYSE:MON) and Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) during Q1, according to its 13F filing.
    • Berkshire more than doubled its stake in Teva to 40.5M shares after first reporting an 18.8M-share stake in Q4 of last year, sending Teva +4.7% after hours; it also raised its holdings in MON to nearly 19M shares from 11.7M, but there were no major new positions.
    • Berkshire's 239.5M shares in AAPL, up from 165M at the end of Q4, make it AAPL's second largest shareholder.
    • Positions were closed in IBM and GHC, while stakes were reduced in PSX and VRSK.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:13 PM | 91 Comments

    Itron signs contract with Network Waitaki Limited

    • Itron (NASDAQ:ITRI) signs a contract with Network Waitaki Limited in New Zeland related to Itron’s Distribution Transformer Monitoring solution.
    • NWL will use Itron’s SaaS applications while operating the DTM solution. 
    • NWL serves nearly 13K customers in New Zealand and 2K km of power lines.  
    • Itron shares are flat aftermarket at $62.13.

    ReWalk receives $5M from investor Timwell; shares up 2% after hours

    Verastem readies $35M stock offering

  • SBLK

    Star Bulk to buy 15 dry bulk vessels in cash and stock deal

    • Star Bulk Carriers (SBLK +1.7%) is higher after agreeing to acquire 15 dry bulk vessels from Songa Bulk for 13.725M common shares and $145M in cash.
    • SBLK will pick up three capesizes, 10 kamsarmaxes, an ultramax and a supramax in the deal, which also adds Songa's Arne Blystad to SBLK's board and Herman Billung to its management team.
    • Following the transaction, Songa shareholders will control a 14.9% in the enlarged SBLK, which also plans to apply for a secondary listing on the Oslo Bors.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:45 PM
  • RNG

    RingCentral chosen for new Arco customer center

    • UK safety firm Arco has chosen RingCentral's (RNG -2.1%) regional unit to provide foundational tech for a new National Customer Engagement Centre.
    • The facility will use RingCentral Contact Centre to provide an omnichannel approach that lets customers communicate via voice, chat, social media, SMS, email and more.
    • The deployment's expected to go fully live in July.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:19 PM | 1 Comment
  • GDP

    Goodrich Petroleum -4% on large Q1 loss, reduced production guidance

    • Goodrich Petroleum (GDP -4%) plunges after reporting much larger than expected Q1 loss and revenue that also lagged analyst expectations.
    • GDP also reduced its FY 2018 production guidance to a new range of 65M-75M cfe/day vs. its previous outlook of 77M-83M cfe/day, citing completion delays, but maintains its 2018 exit rate forecast of 100K cfe/day
    • Q1 production averaged ~37K cfe/day vs. 26K cfe/day in the prior-year period, with natural gas outlook totaling 3B cf (89% of total production) vs. 1.8B cf (79% of total production) during the same quarter in 2017, helped by three operated Haynesville Shale Trend wells completed late in the quarter.
    • GDP also Q2 production so far has averaged 47K cfe/day (92% natural gas) prior to production additions from the Cason-Dickson wells, which the company expects will increase output to more than 70K cfe/day.
    • GDP reaffirms its full-year capital budget outlook of $85M-$95M as well as its preliminary capex plans for 2019 at $125M-$150M.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:14 PM | 1 Comment
  • MEIP

    MEI Pharma secures $75M capital raise; shares up 24%

    • Thinly traded micro cap MEI Pharma (MEIP +24.1%) is up on a 21x surge in volume on the heels of its announcement that it has inked an agreement with institutional investors for the direct sale of common stock and warrants totaling $75M.
    • Specifically, the company will issue ~33M Units at $2.273 per Unit, each comprised of one share of common stock and one warrant to purchase 1/2 of a share of common at $2.54.
    • Proceeds will fund the continued development of lymphoma candidate MEI-401 and general corporate purposes. Closing date is May 16.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:11 PM | 4 Comments

    • MSCI shares are down 1.3% to $158.53.

  • SQM

    Reuters: Chinese lithium company near deal to buy stake in Chile's SQM

    • Sociedad Quimica Y Minera (SQM +3.3%) shoots higher following a Reuters report that China’s Tianqi Lithium is nearing a deal to buy a 24% stake in the Chilean company for ~$4.3B.
    • Tianqi, which is building the world’s biggest lithium processor in Western Australia, is set to sign a deal to acquire the SQM stake from Canadian fertilizer company Nutrien (NTR +1.6%), despite Chilean government opposition to a deal with a Chinese company.
    • Based on SQM’s market value of $14.8B at yesterday’s close, Tianqi would be paying a 22% premium for the shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:07 PM | 15 Comments

  • KOOL

    Cesca down 22% on soft Q1 sales

    • Thinly traded nano cap Cesca Therapeutics (KOOL -22.3%) is down on more than a 4x surge in volume after posting Q1 revenues of $1.9M, down over 42% from a year ago. The company said the shortfall was due to decreased AXP disposable sales in China.
    • Previously: Cesca Therapeutics reports Q1 results (May 14)

  • VRTU

    Virtusa -3.9% on in-line Q4 EPS, in-line guidance

    • Virtusa (NASDAQ:VRTU) drops 3.9% on Q4 results that beat revenue estimates with 25% Y/Y growth and met on EPS. Q1 guidance has in-line revenue of $293.5 to $301.5 (consensus: $298.84) and upside EPS of $0.45 to $0.51 (consensus: $0.42).  
    • FY19 guidance has revenue of $1.23B to $1.27B (consensus: $1.25B) and EPS of $2.08 to $2.32 (consensus: $2.26).  
    • Press release.
    • Previously: Virtusa EPS in-line, beats on revenue (May 15)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:11 PM
  • AZZ

    AZZ down 9% on Q4 earnings miss and weak margins

    • AZZ (AZZ -9%) reported Q4 sales growth of 8.9% Y/Y to $200.66M. Segment sales: Energy $103.51M (+0.8% Y/Y) and metal coatings $97.15M (+19.1% Y/Y).
    • Q4 Margins: Gross declined by 646 bps to 18.9%, operating declined by 692 bps to 4.63%.
    • Segment operating margins: Energy declined by 930 bps to 1.2% and Metals coatings declined by 400 bps to 18.5%.
    • Backlog was at $265.4M (-16.5% Y/Y) and bookings for FY18 were $746.5M (-13.1% Y/Y).
    • "Although Fiscal 2018 was our 31st consecutive year of profitability, we faced challenges on several fronts. We encountered cyclical headwinds in demand, commodity input pricing and a secular downturn in the domestic nuclear business that had a direct impact on our top- and bottom-line performance”, mentioned Tom Ferguson, President and CEO.
    • FY19 Guidance: EPS $1.75-2.25 vs $2.61 consensus and Revenue $900-960M vs $884.79M consensus.
    • Previously: AZZ misses by $0.33, misses on revenue (May 15)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:09 PM

  • AMZN

    JPMorgan: Amazon will match Walmart in US sales by 2021

    • JPMorgan says Amazon (AMZN -1.7%) is on track to match Walmart (WMT +0.5%) in domestic sales by 2020 or 2021.
    • Analyst Christopher Horvers cites Amazon’s key drivers, which include “the Prime ecosystem; endless aisle driven by third-party seller expansion; outsized growth in large, unpenetrated categories, and removing friction and moving closer to customers
    • The analyst notes that Amazon is growing at a faster pace than Walmart in the United States. Last year, Walmart reported $495.8B in annual revenue and U.S. sales of $318.5B (+3.5% Y/Y). Amazon reported $186B U.S. gross merchandise volume last year (+31% Y/Y). 
    • Previously: Seattle scales back tax on Amazon (May 15)
    • Previously: Winners and losers from the retail sales report (May 15)
    • Previously: Amazon moves into blockchain (May 15)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:56 PM | 95 Comments

  • WPP

    Top WPP shareholder backs chairman as Glass Lewis urges ouster

    • A top shareholder has taken sides against a key investor advisory firm in the fight over the fate of the chairman's seat at ad giant WPP.
    • Glass Lewis has recommended shareholders vote against the re-election of Roberto Quarta as chairman.
    • But Harris Associates partner David Herro tells Bloomberg "We do not agree with Glass Lewis ... In our view, the release of the conduct report is not a critical issue. We are more concerned with an orderly succession process and the selection of an excellent and capable CEO."
    • Harris is WPP's No. 3 shareholder, Bloomberg says, with just under 8% of shares.
    • WPP shares are down 2%.
    • Previously: FT: Ex-AOL chief Armstrong a prospect for WPP CEO job (May. 11 2018)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:33 PM
  • PFE

    FDA OKs Pfizer's Epogen/Procrit biosimilar

    • The FDA approves Pfizer (PFE -1%) unit Hospira's Retacrit (epoetin alfa-epbx), a biosimilar of Amgen's (AMGN -2.5%) Epogen and J&J's Procrit.
    • The agency rejected the first submission citing issues at the manufacturing site in Kansas, since resolved.
    • Previously: FDA rejects Pfizer's marketing application for Epogen biosimilar (June 22, 2017)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:06 PM | 3 Comments

  • QCOM

    Reuters: No outward change to China's review of Qualcomm, NXP deal

    • Reuters sources say Qualcomm’s (QCOM -2%) proposed $44B acquisition of NXP Semiconductors (NXPI -0.1%) hasn’t yet seen a breakthrough with Chinese regulators.
    • Approval will likely depend on the US-China trade discussions with government officials meeting this week for the second round of talks.
    • A media report yesterday suggested China had returned to reviewing the deal and that the commerce ministry was asked to speed up the review. But Reuters sources say there hasn’t been an “outward change in the review process.”  
    • Previously: China restarts Qualcomm-NXP deal review (May 14)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:48 AM | 41 Comments
  • NM

    Navios Maritime down on earnings miss

    • Navios Maritime (NM -5.6%) reports revenue from dry bulk vessel operations rose 25.6% to $64.7M in Q1.
    • Logistics business revenue grew 19.2% to $52.2M.
    • Adjusted EBITDA advanced 60.6% to $28.1M.
    • Rates for dry bulk vessels improved materially, with the 40% increase in TCE for the quarter.
    • Previously: Navios Maritime misses by $0.04, misses on revenue (May 15)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:43 AM
  • EOLS

    FDA action date today for Evolus' competitor to BOTOX; shares up 5%

    • Thinly traded micro cap Evolus (EOLS +4.5%) is up on modestly higher volume ahead of today's expected FDA decision on its marketing application for prabotulinumtoxinA for the treatment of moderate-to-severe frown lines.
    • Related ticker: (AGN -1%)
    • Previously: Evolus' prabotulinumtoxinA 90 kDa on par with Allergan's Botox in late-stage study (April 5)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:37 AM | 12 Comments
  • ENT

    Global Eagle sinks to 52-week low after Q1 miss

    • Global Eagle Entertainment (NASDAQ:ENT) is off 6.4% and tagging a 52-week low today after its Q1 earnings missed on top and bottom lines.
    • Net loss narrowed to $38.3M, mainly due to a year-ago goodwill impairment (of $78M) that didn't recur this year.
    • EBITDA was up slightly to $17.3M.
    • Total revenue got a slight boost from Connectivity growth, driven by new aircraft, vessel and site additions along with some new equipment sales.
    • Impact from applying the new ASC 606 standard was a decrease in revenue of $0.7M, along with a decrease in cost of goods sold of $0.4M and immaterial impact to income and EBITDA.
    • Revenue breakout: Licensing and services, $146.5M (up 2%); Equipment, $9.97M (up 11.4%).
    • Conference call to come at 5 p.m. ET.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 11:34 AM
  • LIQT

    LiqTech International up 9% post Q1 results

    • LiqTech International (LIQT +9.7%) reported Q1 revenue decrease of 19.5% Y/Y to $2.39M due to decrease in sales of liquid filters and systems of $0.2M and a decrease in sales of DPFs of $0.4M.
    • Q1 gross margin declined by 1,164 bps to -2.5% and operating margin declined by 2,463 bps to -58.6%.
    • R&D expenses were up by 17.7% Y/Y to $0.17M, G&A increased by 13.2% Y/Y to $0.68M and selling declined by 9.9% Y/Y to $0.41M.
    • In Q1 the company entered into 3 significant contracts that will help facilitate large orders in future periods.
    • "Our results for the first quarter were below our expectations, which was largely attributable to delayed deliveries of our marine scrubber water treatment systems”, mentioned Mr. Sune Mathiesen, CEO.
    • Previously: LiqTech EPS in-line, beats on revenue (May 15)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:30 AM
  • DAVE

    More on Famous Dave's of America Q1 results

    • Famous Dave's of America (DAVE -1.9%) reported Q1 revenue decrease by 24.3% Y/Y to $12.8M of which; Restaurant sales were $8.7M (-32.6% Y/Y); Franchise royalty & fee of $3.1M (-8.1% Y/Y); Franchisee national advertising fund contributions $0.5M & Licensing & other revenue of $0.3M (+17.1% Y/Y).
    • Company-owned comparable restaurant sales increased 5.2%, with traffic up 5.3% whereas, Franchise-operated comparable restaurant sales declined 1.6%.
    • Adj. EBITDA improved 1,169 bps to 14.1%; Restaurant level operating margin was -0.5%.
    • Q1 overall expenses: Food & beverage costs increased 170 bps to 32.1%; Labor & benefits costs declined 40 bps to 36.7%; Operating expenses increased 90 bps to 32.6% & General & administrative declined 1,220 bps to 14.6%.
    • System-wide restaurant sales were $87,166 (-13.2% Y/Y).
    • Total Restaurant count of 152 (-12.1% Y/Y) where Franchise-operated were 136 (-1.4% Y/Y) & Company-owned were 16 (-54.3% Y/Y).
    • Previously: Famous Dave's of America beats by $0.06, misses on revenue (May 14)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:30 AM
  • PNTR

    Pointer Telocation beats estimates in Q1

    • Pointer Telocation (PNTR -4.1%) reports service revenue growth of 12.2% to $13.8M in Q1, due to the growth in the subscriber base.
    • Products revenue up 6% to $7.1M.
    • Gross margin rate improved 310 bps to 52.4%.
    • Adjusted operating margin rate expanded 110 bps 14.8%.
    • EBITDA grew 5% to $3.27M for the quarter.
    • Total subscribers +15% Y/Y to 265K.
    • Previously: Pointer Telocation beats by $0.08, beats on revenue (May 15)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM
  • HSY

    Volatile trading on Hershey

    • Shares of Hershey (HSY +0.4%) are having a volatile day, ranging from as low as $90.67 to as high as $94.29 within one hour.
    • There is some merger chatter with traders behind the scenes that appears to be adding to options buying on Hershey.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM | 30 Comments

    Healthcare - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 11:00 AM (05/15/2018)

    • Gainers: MDGS +31%. PFNX +19%. AST +15%. MEIP +12%. MYND +11%.

    | 11:00 AM
  • NYNY

    Empire Resorts updates on sports betting

    • Empire Resorts (NYNY -0.8%) is the latest casino company to update on its sports betting plans after the landmark SCOTUS decision.
    • "We are prepared to implement sports betting as part of the gaming experience at our resort casino, Resorts World Catskills, upon the formulation of relevant regulations in New York State," says Empire CEO Ryan Eller.
    • "We are one of the few New York State venues that can be authorized to host a sports pool under New York’s Gaming Act. It is our hope that New York State will be ready for New Yorkers to place legal sports bets in time for the fall football season, baseball’s World Series, or even sooner," he adds.
    • The New York State Gaming Commission will need to formulate regulations to govern sports pools before the company can apply for a license to offer sports betting at Resorts World Catskills.
    • Source: Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 10:54 AM
  • GNMX

    Aevi Genomic Medicine files for $50M mixed shelf offering

    • Aevi Genomic Medicine (GNMX -4.1%) has filed a prospectus for a $50M mixed shelf offering.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:53 AM

    • Dynatronics (DYNT +4.6%) has filed a prospectus for a $50M mixed shelf offering.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:50 AM
  • XNET

    Xunlei Limited 7% lower after guiding to sequential revenue drop

    • Xunlei Limited (NASDAQ:XNET) is 7% lower after posting Q1 earnings where revenue more than doubled and the company swung to a gain, but it guided to as much as a 28% sequential drop in revenues.
    • Gross profit was down 5.2% sequentially to $37.7M, and gross margin declined to 47.8% from last quarter's 48.2%.
    • Operating income rose to $7.4M from last quarter's $3.9M. And non-GAAP net income rose to $7.9M from the prior quarter's $4.8M (and a year-ago loss of $7M).
    • Revenue by segment: Cloud computing and Internet value-added services, $48.1M (up 316.4%); Subscription, $23.4M (up 12.3%); Online advertising, $7.3M (up 92.2%).
    • Cash, equivalents and short-term investments came to $355.6M, down from $372.4M as of Dec. 31.
    • For Q2, it's guiding to revenues of $56M-$62M (53.2% growth at the midpoint).
    • Earnings call transcript

    Scotts Miracle-Gro upped to Buy at SunTrust as best cannabis play

    • Scotts Miracle-Gro (SMG +2.4%) moves higher after SunTrust Robinson Humphrey upgrades shares to Buy from Hold with a $100 price target, raised from $80, citing its recent acquisition of hydroponics distributor Sunlight Supply.
    • The acquisition "gives SMG immediate impact on the [hydroponics] category," writes SunTrust analyst William Chappell. "For investors, there is a dearth of ways to play the legalization trend in the public equity markets, and SMG is one of the largest companies in terms of market cap with a firm foot in the door of the industry."
    • Chappell thinks investors increasingly view SMG "as a call option on the cannabis legalization trend which should provide a rising floor for the stock. As this business faces easier comparisons in F1Q19 and returns to growth, we also expect investors to jump back on this vehicle for riding the legalization wave."
    • BofA Merrill Lynch downgraded SMG two weeks ago following the company's sharp Q1 earnings miss.

    • Hollysys Automation Technologies (HOLI +24.8%) Q3 revenue grew by 32.1% Y/Y to $120.62M. Revenue split: Integrated contract $104.74 (+34% Y/Y), product sales $9.91M (+1.7% Y/Y) and services rendered $5.97M (+76.2% Y/Y).
    • Segment revenues: Industrial automation +20% Y/Y to $45.7M, and contracts +55.6% Y/Y to $82.2M; Rail business +30.9% Y/Y to $45.5M, while contracts declined by 24.6% Y/Y to $37.9M; and Mechanical and electrical installation services +59.4% Y/Y to $29.4M and contracts +303% Y/Y to $21.2M.

    • Q3 Expenses: Selling increased by 4.1% Y/Y to $6.2M, G&A declined by 13% Y/Y to $7.62M due to a decrease of $2.3M in bad debt provision and R&D increased by 43.7% Y/Y to 8.76M.

    • FY18 Outlook, reaffirmed: Revenue $500-530M vs $521.73M consensus and non-GAAP net income of $100-110M.

  • NOK

    Nokia names Reddy as co-president of ION unit

    • Nokia (NOK -1.7%) has named Sri Reddy to its leadership team, putting Reddy in as co-president of its IP/Optical Networks business group.
    • Current ION president Basil Alwan will continue as a member of the Group Leadership Team as a co-president of that business and adviser to the CEO.
    • Reddy played a key role in building the IP routing business from the ground up, Nokia says; he led the IP Software Engineering team for more than 10 years before leading the IP Routing business unit for the past five.
    • As for the responsibility split, Reddy will mainly handle day-to-day operational matters and jointly manage strategy and overall performance.
    • "I am pleased to see the bench strength of great leaders at Nokia, which allows us to benefit from the capabilities of all our team members," says CEO Rajeev Suri.

  • Gold tumbles below 200-day MA as 10-year Treasury yield pierces 3%

    • Gold prices plunge to YTD lows following economic reports on retail sales and manufacturing, adding to pressure from climbing rates in the benchmark 10-year Treasury.
    • June gold currently -1.6%, or ~$21, at $1,297.20/oz., which would represent the lowest close gold for a most-active contract since late December and pushes the metal well below its 200-day moving average at $1,307.80, also for the first time since late December.
    • U.S. data showed retail sales rising for a second straight month in April and the Empire State manufacturing index rose in May, both pointing to an improving economy.
    • Investors may be concerned that the Fed could try to slow down the economy by raising interest rates more aggressively.

  • INO

    Inovio's HIV vaccine shows positive effect in early-stage study; shares up 8% premarket

    • Inovio Pharmaceuticals (NYSEMKT:INO) is up 8% premarket on robust volume on the heels of its announcement of positive results from a Phase 1 clinical trial assessing its HIV vaccine PENNVAX GP. The data were presented at the HVTN Full Group Meeting in Washington, D.C.
    • Participants receiving PENNVAX GP experienced durable robust immune responses at month 12, six months after the last dose. The HIV-specific CD4+ T cell and binding antibody response rates were close to 100% when delivered with its CELLECTRA device.
    • The percentage of subjects who experienced immune responses immediately after the last dose maintained or increased their responses over the six-month follow-up period.
    • The company plans to continue development.
